title: 112_s3253
content: The "Expanding Access to Capital for Entrepreneurial Leaders Act" or the "EXCEL Act" authorizes a program under the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 with a total amount not exceeding $4,000,000,000 annually. Additionally, the amendment increases the fund limit from $225,000,000 to $350,000,000 and includes adjustments for inflation. Section 303(b)(2) is amended to adjust dollar amounts annually based on the Consumer Price Index. The CPI will be used to adjust dollar amounts annually starting from the effective date of the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009. SEC. 5. PUBLIC AVAILABILITY OF INFORMATION: The Administrator will annually publish on its website information about each small business investment company, including capital deployed, leverage drawn, number of investments, businesses receiving capital, industry sectors invested in, leverage principal repaid, and investment strategy. SEC. 6. AUTHORIZED USES OF LICENSING FEES. SEC. 6. AUTHORIZED USES OF LICENSING FEES. Section 301(e) of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to include other small business investment company program needs. SEC. 7. SENSE OF CONGRESS. The sense of Congress is that small business investment companies should partner with community banks and lenders. The Administrator should increase outreach to encourage investments in small business investment companies. Companies are actively seeking and making investments in small businesses, partnering with governors, mayors, states, and municipalities to increase outreach to underserved and rural areas, and improving the small business investment company program webpage for better visibility and user-friendliness.
